item.title: Jeffry add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I'll want to hear,' Samuel said. 'I eat stories like grapes." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jeffry add a quote by Lynne Truss
item.description: "Thurber was asked by a correspondent: "Why did you have a comma in the sentence, 'After dinner, the men went into the living-room'?" And his answer was probably one of the loveliest things ever said about punctuation. "This particular comma," Thurber explained, "was Ross's way of giving the men time to push back their chairs and stand up." -- Lynne Truss

item.title: Jeffry add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "I conveniently forgot to remember that people only have two hands, or, as another parent once said of having a third child, it's time for a zone defense instead of man-to-man." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Jeffry add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Jeffry add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx
